text:
I was sad to hear of the passing of Jersey City Councilman Michael Yun.  He was a dedicated family man, businessman, and community organizer for Jersey CIty.  
My sincere condolences to his family.  Please keep them in your prayers during this holy week. https://t.co/jt5o00Dp3x

While we social distance, it is the brave men and women of our U.S. mail and other delivery companies who are handling our survival needs.

I want to thank every one of them for their incredible work to supply us during this difficult time.  
 #USPS #FedEx #UPS #DHL #delivery https://t.co/cpML9Cxo2w

Today is the 52nd Anniversary of the death of Dr. Martin Luther King.  

I wanted to send this out to remind us of what really makes people great.  Stay safe and remember that these temporary sacrifices will help us defeat this dreaded disease. https://t.co/pLqNuuNTrk

GREAT NEWS for Newark Small Business Owners!!

Mayor Baraka has a new program to give property owners tax relief in exchange for not evicting tenants for one year.
 
For more information, e-mail the Newark Department of Economic Housing and Development at ehd@ci.newark.nj.us. https://t.co/2PKuiY46TA

I was absolutely delighted to hear that Majority Whip Jim Clyburn will chair the panel to oversee the more than $2 trillion from the coronavirus stimulus fund.  

He is a man of incredible integrity who will make sure that money is spent wisely and effectively. https://t.co/TptbLjI30d

SCAM WARNING!

NEWARK NEEDS YOUR HELP!!

If you haven't filled out our census form, please do so today.

If you have, please resend this around and encourage others to do the same so we can get everyone counted.  Newark is counting on you.   
#newarkcounts @CityofNewarkNJ @rasjbaraka https://t.co/A5J7ONfLGf

I was sad to hear of the passing Tuesday of a medical hero, Dr. Frank Gabrin, due to #covid19. 

Dr. Gabrin worked to treat patients at East Orange General Hospital despite the risks.   We owe him and all our medical heroes a tremendous debt during this crisis.
#stayhomestaysafe https://t.co/rqGLKd2U1o
RT @SBAgov: Small businesses can get up to a $10,000 advance on an Economic Injury Disaster Loan even if your previous application was decl…

NJ GETS MORE MONEY!!!!

The Federal Transit Administration (FTA) said New Jersey will get almost $1.8 billion to help the state's transit industry, more than the projected $1.25 billion.  It's great news and will help maintain our infrastructure during this coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/NMnjcGVLAr

CORONAVIRUS SUPPORT UPDATE:
Small Businesses can begin to apply for stimulus help tomorrow, April 3rd and direct deposits of stimulus checks begin in two weeks.  Mailed checks will begin May 1.  

Find more info at https://t.co/X7zH0M40lk and https://t.co/TGcYcZ7gyh https://t.co/u5hyLq54Dp

Today is national Census Day.  Yet, the numbers of responses in our 10th district are surprisingly low.  You should have received a notice in the mail with your census number.  Use it to fill out your census questions and get information at https://t.co/oz5RDENWsL. https://t.co/YolXaiJXte

CORONAVIRUS INFO UPDATE:

If you want to contact the Governor's office for any reason during this coronavirus crisis, contact the Office of Constituent Relations at Constituent.Relations@nj.gov.  

It's far more effective than a phone call. Please pass it on. https://t.co/Z3PQP7S61Z
@Lady_Quinnzel I'd like to help, so let me know more details on your situation.  Please call my office at (973) 645-3213 and we can figure out the best way to help you.  Thank you.

Today, we celebrate the 150th anniversary of the 15th Amendment.  It gave African-Americans the right to vote and we need to exercise it on Nov. 3rd to vote for a new President.

Register to vote here:  https://t.co/cdXQeJ24kx 

Please retweet it to increase registrations. https://t.co/J2Ck4Dgo69

I am absolutely FURIOUS at how Trump has handled our coronavirus crisis.  Now he wants to delay desperately needed payment checks until he can sign his name to the bottom.

People are dying from this disease!!  We need leadership now!!   
#DeposittThePeoplesMoneyNOW https://t.co/4lyPO7GeIc

Glad to hear Gov. Murphy will provide mortgage payment relief to New Jersey homeowners.

Visit the website below to see if you qualify.

https://t.co/uQCs4bdrof https://t.co/LdQny7ZZq8

Sad to hear of Rev. Joseph Lowery's passing.  He really was the dean of the civil rights movement and a true man of God.  He was an inspiration to me and millions of other African-Americans.  My condolences to his family during this difficult time.   
https://t.co/XTnzwI1BJt https://t.co/BNsOMr2KeE
Very glad to see Gov. Murphy provide $70 million in extra NJ SNAP benefits for the next two months to help New Jerseyans buy food. https://t.co/80RZQgt7yn

Today, my New Jersey colleagues and I wrote a letter to ask Pres. Trump to declare New Jersey a Major Disaster area to free up more federal funds to combat coronavirus.  

Cases in NY are increasing daily.  We need more funding to protect state and district residents. https://t.co/80QZYJqHJi
@Astrong91 @realDonaldTrump @SenatorMenendez @CoryBooker Alex-  Call my office and explain your situation: (973) 645-3213.  Then we can see what we can do to help.

It has been 10 years since the Affordable Care Act (or Obamacare) was signed into law.  

As we battle the coronavirus global pandemic, I'm glad and relieved that so many Americans have medical insurance.
#ProtectOurCare #ForThePeople https://t.co/sZmN3YeFzu

CORONAVIRUS UPDATE:

New Jersey has a website dedicated to coronavirus information.

It is https://t.co/ClpOrCc5dO 

Please visit it to get the latest number of cases statewide as well as recent restrictions. https://t.co/CwlSEBrbgO

CORONAVIRUS UPDATE:

UNION COUNTY opened the first drive-through testing facility for the disease. @countyofunionnj 

But don't rush out until you get an APPOINTMENT that can only be made at your DOCTOR'S OFFICE.  So see your health care specialist immediately if you need one. https://t.co/9qj5Tnhd4S

Also today, I co-signed a Congressional letter to make sure our community health centers are fully funded during this public health crisis and asked Peter Gaynor, the FEMA Administrator, when hospitals and health facilities can expect to get masks and other vital supplies. https://t.co/8MkdiN99f5

Today, I co-signed a letter to the State Department to ask them to work with government agencies, foreign governments, and commercial airlines to help Americans home who are abroad. two letters related to our coronavirus public health crisis. https://t.co/8dqZfTOXXx

As the coronavirus continues to cause stress and anxiety nationwide, I want to take a moment to thank America's health care workers.

They are putting their lives at risk every day to heal the sick and keep us safe.  I want to thank all of them for their dedication and care. https://t.co/CwbO0rFN0r

I am looking for every way possible to restrict the spread of coronavirus in New Jersey.  

I co-signed a letter to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement to work harder to prevent disease after an employee at a detention facility in Elizabeth, NJ tested positive for it. https://t.co/6WhPkHq8lR

CORONAVIRUS CASES IN NEW JERSEY...

If you want to know how many positive cases have been uncovered in your New Jersey county, please visit the website below.

https://t.co/6xVazGhs2N

Feel free to retweet it to all your friends and family. https://t.co/zPoeAvq8wn

I signed on to a letter asking the President to approve help from the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and U.S. Military to handle possible coronavirus cases in New Jersey.

NJ needs more hospital beds and the extra help could even create field hospitals, if necessary. https://t.co/qoDCSmxrab

We are going to need to have patience during this coronavirus heath crisis.  

As the Chairman of the House Homeland Security Subcommittee on Emergency Preparedness, Response, and Recovery, I have been in frequent contact with NJ Gov. Murphy to discuss what I can do to help. https://t.co/eCiSHoFyX7

Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is suspending in-person services at field offices, asylum offices and Application Support Centers (ASCs) until April 1.  

For more information, visit https://t.co/bt6aw63ZmP for help or https://t.co/EppchE65PB for updates. https://t.co/L3M4Patl6F

I signed on to a Congressional letter to President Trump to marshal the Department of Defense resources to help fight coronavirus.  It could help create mobile hospitals, aid vaccine research and development, and manufacture emergency equipment, like ventilators when necessary. https://t.co/5nBd3uuVIY
Mayor Baraka is holding a virtual town hall to discuss the coronavirus today.  Please tune in or call in if you have any questions or concerns. https://t.co/18TBjmZRxj

I want to wish everyone a Happy St. Patrick's Day!!  

Even though trips to a local Irish pub won't happen, it's important to celebrate the day in your own way.  We cannot let the coronavirus crush our spirits.  

Feel free to post pictures of your indoor festivities. https://t.co/xTK7DoLN5G

New Jersey One-Stop Career Center offices have suspended services  for at least two weeks. 

You can file for unemployment insurance at https://t.co/0Sgtws61xR

North Jersey:  (201) 601-4100 
Central Jersey:  (732) 761-2020 
Southern Jersey:  (856) 507-2340 https://t.co/zOaX7QREiy

I urge everyone to take this seriously. We need everyone to STAY HOME.

New Jersey needs more medical supplies.  I signed on to a letter today to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services to request supplies from the Strategic National Stockpile to help our state.  

For more information on the disease, visit https://t.co/IliGVhzqiV https://t.co/ZsWvKjboKC

GOOD NEWS for NEW JERSEY!!!!

Gov. Murphy will give a two-month extension to all residents who need to renew their driver’s licenses, auto registration, or vehicle inspection by May 31 due to coronavirus concerns.    

For more information, visit https://t.co/IxMzNOxYjT https://t.co/brvnz9wiSX

I was extremely proud to vote for the coronavirus support bill early this morning.  This is an economic crisis as well as a public health and safety one.  American workers need paid sick leave to avoid possibly spreading the disease in their workplace.  

https://t.co/GUfZ25rC2O https://t.co/CLKG2Dk0Lp

President Trump declared a state of emergency today to deal with the coronavirus.  

For more information about the coronavirus, please visit: https://t.co/hAeoaNKOQ4 or https://t.co/ij9kvSnAfD.

Or call the NJ Coronavirus & Poison Center at
1-800-222-1222 or 1-800-962-1253. https://t.co/4MTRDbRTSU

I was honored and humbled today to receive a Congressional award for my House Floor speeches.  It is a pleasure to highlight the great people, organizations and events of our district.  I know it is your accomplishments that helped me earn this trophy. https://t.co/DxdR95kgrQ

Last night, I praised a scoring sensation from our district, Rakiyah Sellers.  The senior guard at College of Saint Elizabeth scored her 1,000th career point in February.  She started at Ivy Hill Elementary School in Newark and starred as a Lady Jaguar at Newark Arts High School. https://t.co/USNs6xd3gM

Today is the first day to participate in the 2020 census.  Please watch my video to understand the importance of the census.

If you want to fill out the form online, visit https://t.co/u0fzQB4pxh

If you want to be considered for a census job, visit https://t.co/WNM3L8lpix https://t.co/DKmF6sVHV7

Also, I know that small businesses have suffered because of the coronavirus. I’m delighted that @HouseDemocrats’ supplemental bill allows for an estimated $7 billion in low-interest loans to help those affected by the outbreak. #COVID19 https://t.co/VQDDEcTRd7

Congratulations again to the West Orange High School cheerleaders.  They earned a trophy for finishing 8th out of 32 squads last February in the finals of the 2020 UCA National Cheerleading Championship in Orlando, Florida.  
@woschools https://t.co/wug69s880O

Roselle Park did us all proud with a national championship and bronze medal at the National Cheerleading championships.  

I am proud of them and praised them on the House floor last night. https://t.co/4TwI9lAXn7

NJ Gov. Murphy declared a coronavirus State of Emergency for New Jersey today.  Please proper action to keep you and your loved ones safe from this disease.

For more information, call the NJ Coronavirus & Poison Center Hotline at 1-800-222-1222 or visit https://t.co/oocGYxQl4o https://t.co/XBOdHQtdaj

Today we celebrate International Women's Day!  

This year is a special one because we observe the 100th anniversary of the 19th Amendment to the Constitution, which granted women the right to vote.  

Image from https://t.co/K7eeoGebDd https://t.co/oh4d7deBMj

It was 8 years ago today that I lost my father, Donald M. Payne, Sr., to colon cancer.  

I am honored to represent the 10th district of New Jersey, but I wish he were still here to be your Congressman. https://t.co/uKHhZVSJ2d
I wanted to take time today to meet with Linda Street, from the Pink Dragon Artist Gallery in Newark.  She showed me some of Jerry Grant's artwork and I was happy to see it. https://t.co/pPHR7k8u0d
I had a great time meeting with the students of University Heights Charter School in Newark today. https://t.co/Vz7kZl7yA9

It was an honor to join House Speaker Nancy Pelosi today as she signed the Coronavirus Emergency Response Package.  It provides $7.8 billion to fund efforts to prevent coronavirus and find new treatments to limit infections. https://t.co/8zGBIwUlrI

I had the true pleasure of addressing the Black Women's Roundtable today.  The roundtable gathers some of the country's smartest and most talented women to discuss the most critical issues facing black America.  

It's a great event and I was excited to be a part of it. https://t.co/ggg4OZKSmK
I enjoyed my conversation with Priya Sequeira, division vice president of DaVita Inc., about the BETTER Kidney Care Act. https://t.co/7MoBPrF04P

I was proud of my colleagues for their bipartisan support of our $7.8 billion bill to fight the coronavirus.  Now, we need that same bipartisan support to uphold the Affordable Care Act to keep 25 million Americans from becoming uninsured. https://t.co/0G6qvtNCGO
I enjoyed my meeting today with a few members of the Black Women's Roundtable. https://t.co/s8WRtnncEF
It was great to talk with members of the YMCA Youth and Government from New Jersey today. https://t.co/DlCbRUBFGk
I enjoyed my meeting today with the Submarine Industrial Base Council to discuss defense issues. https://t.co/tuX0wEsCK5

I had a good meeting today with the National MS Society to discuss funding of MS policy priorities, including MS research, surprise billing and Real Emergency Access for Aging and Disability Inclusion in Disasters Act and Disaster Relief Medicaid Act. https://t.co/90lWmg414U
I had a great meeting today with Joan Helfman, Lisa Buckley, and Nell Granger from the American Association of Cardiovascular and Pulmonary Rehabilitation. https://t.co/fF5ugKazEx
Today, I had a good meeting with AIPAC representatives, including many of my constituents. https://t.co/GKHZu40k60
I enjoyed my meeting with Eric Levin and Jocelyn Hill from Conrail today. https://t.co/fJTZoNdmKw

America’s public schools are the foundation of success for young people across this country. That’s why I support the Rebuild America’s School Act, which would invest $100 billion in critical physical and digital infrastructure of public schools. #MovingForward
@HouseDemocrats
Great to see my friends at the DNC Veterans and Military Families Retreat Council at VFW Post 1941. https://t.co/woBs0CTYV8

I enjoyed my meeting with Victoria Palmer-Gillard, principal of Hillside Middle School.  When I was young, I went to Hillside.  So it was good to visit and hear about the school's programs. https://t.co/L88A6cjh1M

I introduced a bill today to recognize March as National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month.  I sponsored a similar resolution annually for the last seven years as part of my focus on colorectal cancer awareness and prevention.
#stopbowelcancer https://t.co/AmUYRLXoMI
Today, I honored Henry Hamilton.  He is the principal of Whitney Houston Academy and one of our district's most revered educators. https://t.co/teDUiJZt1e

Charles Hall, Jr. has dedicated his life to the betterment of American workers across northern New Jersey.  He has won battles for increased wages, better health benefits, and improved working conditions.

I had the honor of praising his contributions yesterday. https://t.co/EQmi5qACQ0

It was great to work with my fellow New Jersey Democrats today to discuss how to best promote the Census to get an accurate count, the Gateway Project, and coronavirus preparedness, amongst other issues. https://t.co/murxdnrEIE

If you are concerned about coronavirus. please visit this great resource from @CDCgov: 

https://t.co/osTDpPW674 https://t.co/5oYpCLUUOn
I had a great meeting today with Col. Joe Abegg, Maj. Brian Gross, and several cadets with the New Jersey Wing of the Civil Air Patrol. https://t.co/NmrjNCQz2N

It's been a full year since the House passed #HR8, a bipartisan bill requiring background checks on gun sales.

Since then, more than 38,000 Americans have died from gun violence while it sits in the Senate.  90% of Americans support it, so it is time to vote on it.

I had the great honor of praising Joyce Watterman, Jersey City Council President, today on the House floor.

Watch my tribute here. https://t.co/GLDELdD3Rd

I had a good meeting with Chris Burgos today.  He represents the Coalition Against Bigger Trucks (CABT) and wanted to discuss the dangers of larger big rigs on American highways. https://t.co/F5aITlLDKD

When I heard my district could lose as much as $5 million in FEMA urban area security initiative grants (UASI), I was livid.  

I called Bridget Bean, the FEMA grants administrator, today to discuss my concerns and see how we can get that money back to the district. https://t.co/jv9zoNzVAm

I am delighted the House passed the #EmmettTill Antilynching Act today! 

The bill designates lynching as a federal hate crime.  Emmett Till's story is a national tragedy.  I applaud Rep. Bobby Rush for sponsoring this bill.  #OutlawLynching @RepBobbyRush https://t.co/tOxcblVP09

#WeCount, so learn more!⬇️

Sad to hear of the death of Katherine Johnson, a NASA mathematician who helped get us to the moon.  Her story was the focus of the Oscar-nominated film, Hidden Figures.

She is a great reason why we need to promote more STEM studies in our urban schools.

https://t.co/qJchlXoWOy https://t.co/edQXsWTyR5
I enjoyed speaking with the Union County Black Leadership Council Saturday. https://t.co/PoIA64yruG

RT @DonaldNorcross: The 4 Donald’s in Congress, trying to make our namesake great again. 
@RepDonaldPayne @RepMcEachin @RepDonBeyer https:/…
It was great to honor a few of the amazing people in our district during my Black History Month Celebration. https://t.co/lBLuVtlaDV

"Full Blown National Security Crisis" - Former CIA Director John Brennan.

Trump's actions have supported Russian efforts to meddle in the 2020 election and keep him in office.  Read the story.  It is incredibly disturbing, but not at all surprising.

https://t.co/T9iR7Hm14Q https://t.co/zn6LmCVTFc

Today, I was delighted to honor the Congressional App Challenge winners from NJ-10, Abraham Rubio and Paul Aquino.

Their app, the "School Notifier," would improve school communication with students.  I could see schools nationwide using their app very soon.  
#Congress4CS https://t.co/DQcprUEGUl

I want to wish a very Happy Birthday to Rep. John Lewis!

The civil rights icon and most courageous member of the House turns 80 years old today.  

With your birthday wishes, please pray he has a complete recovery from his battle with pancreatic cancer.    
@repjohnlewis https://t.co/j72b2nTjeg

At my lunch with my friends at Pathways to College yesterday, I was delighted to discuss Oprah Winfrey's generous $5 million gift to the program.  She is a tremendous supporter of communities of color. I'm proud she will invest in Newark.  
#oprahwinfrey 

https://t.co/t2a8ya9D7e https://t.co/nHd5g5zwUn
I enjoyed my time at the Pathways to College luncheon today. https://t.co/q1c33BWXjj

It was a pleasure to see Tayshyana Thompson again.  She wanted to thank me for my help in getting her an educational scholarship.  She is an attorney now and doing great things. https://t.co/ue0BUjinxT

I enjoyed my meeting with J Street today.  They represent a pro-Israel, pro-peace Americans advocacy group.  They are are strongly against Trump's plan to allow Israel to continue annexation of lands in the West Bank. https://t.co/pydPPVkBUD

The Masked Singer is coming to the PAC in Newark!!  

If you love the show, get tickets now.

https://t.co/udtabBkASf https://t.co/0EQKH9Y8Cy

I am excited that we are one step closer to making this historic amendment a part of the U.S. Constitution. https://t.co/ScosYTWnB2

This morning, BET executives rang the opening bell at Nasdaq to celebrate BET Network's 40th anniversary this year.

$500 billion from Medicare

During Black History Month, it is important to understand the power of voting for our African-American communities.

I really enjoyed meeting all the Rutgers students during the CBC Black Leadership Summit this week. https://t.co/iCGkC4Msug
Trump’s latest attack on the Affordable Care Act is cutting Medicaid, plain and simple. Another broken promise from a broken Administration. #ProtectOurCare

Today, we heard from Homeland Security officials about the use of facial recognition technology.

I have major concerns about this use. African Americans are misidentified 10 to 100 times more than others. I asked what they are doing to correct this issue. https://t.co/TzsernGSJn

Gun violence is a national tragedy.  Yet, it could be prevented with laws like the ones we have in New Jersey already.

I spoke about it on the floor today. https://t.co/5uJjRYOWwo

THANK YOU!!!!

For all the feedback last night. I chose not to attend SOTU because Trump has disgraced his office, but 63% of Facebook users said I should go while 70% of Twitter users said I should not. I enjoyed reading all your comments and plan to ask again in the future. https://t.co/gSd0pexsTM

Congratulations to Darius Brown!  

The 7th grader from North Star Academy was awarded a Prudential Spirit of Community Award for his work to make bow ties for dogs in shelters and find them homes.

I enjoyed my meeting with George S.W. Patten, Sr., the Liberian ambassador to the United States. https://t.co/QSjIUHiLk4

Tonight, President Trump will try to distract Americans from his all-out assault on people with pre-existing conditions and his failure on prescription drug prices.  

We need to remind him that people should not have to choose between food or medicine!

I had a great meeting today with Joanne Bradforth (second from the left) to discuss a bill I am co-sponsoring to reduce heat stroke in student athletes.
